sub_title: PhD Candidate at Radboud University Nijmegen | Spatial planning & governance of the energy transition
summary:
I am a researcher and educator whose interests lie in the governance of and participation in the energy transition, urban sustainability & technology challenges, and education & science communication. 

In my work, I intend to build bridges between academia and practice, and to help shape and realize inclusive practices for moving towards a more sustainable society.

projects.title: Study Trip to Kosovo
projects.description:
Visiting multiple governmental and non-governmental organizations and institutions involved in conflict resolution and peace building activities; staying in a host family in Prishtina for 10 days. 

This trip has been the start of a course called Peace Lab that is currently on offer at the Amsterdam University College. On the study trip's blog you can read the stories of students that have taken this course and been on a trip to Kosovo, including mine.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at Radboud University Nijmegen | Spatial planning & governance of the energy transition

projects.title: Final Research Paper (Profielwerkstuk)
projects.description: Analysis of the objective and subjective safety among inhabitants of the Vinex-location Leidsche Rijn, Utrecht. We found that there was an apparent discrepancy between both kinds of safety, and investigated the possible reasons for this. Graded 9.0/10.0 and included in the top-50 shortlist for 'Economie & Maatschappij' in the 'KNAW Onderwijsprijs'.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at Radboud University Nijmegen | Spatial planning & governance of the energy transition

projects.title: Bachelor's Thesis Research
projects.description:
Title: Will Cities Save the Day?—An Analysis of the Influence of Transnational Municipal Climate Networks on Urban Climate Governance in the Netherlands

Grade: 9.2/10.0

My Bachelor's thesis research has set out to answer the question: What influence do transnational municipal climate networks (TMCNs) have on urban climate governance? In order to do so, I have examined municipalities in the Netherlands that are members to different types of TMCNs so as to find out 1) why they have decided to join (different types of) TMCNs, and 2) to what extent these (different types of) TMCNs are able to influence their member municipalities’ local, vertical, and horizontal climate governance practices.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at Radboud University Nijmegen | Spatial planning & governance of the energy transition

projects.title: Amsterdam Circular Challenge 2015
projects.description:
The Amsterdam Circular Challenge aimed to encourage circular thinking in Amsterdam by introducing students and young professionals to issues encountered by businesses in their move toward circularity. 

In a team of five students, I have worked on a business case concerning local, circular food entrepreneurship in Amsterdam. The case was provided by Alliander and Amsterdam Smart City.

contributors.headline: PhD Candidate at Radboud University Nijmegen | Spatial planning & governance of the energy transition
Area Sales Manager BeNeLux bij Piller Power Systems

projects.title: Sustainability Challenge 2014
projects.description:
The Sustainability Challenge, an initiative by Sustainable Motion, is a business case competition in which 100 young professionals - undergraduate, graduate, PhD, or former students - worked on issues related to sustainability in business environments. 

In teams of five, these students were asked to draft a solution for a problem or challenge related to sustainability as experienced by leading Dutch companies Liander, Vitens, PostNL, VolkerWessels, and Cofely GDF Suez. To do so, they had the opportunity to consult company representatives and experts in various academic and occupational fields.The resulting solutions were then presented to the respective companies by each of the teams; one of the solutions was chosen by a jury representing the concerned company. Following this, each elected team improved and adjusted its solution under the guidance of company representatives. On 27 November, the five solutions to the business cases were presented to a jury consisting of the director of 'Het Groene Brein', the rector magnificus of the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, and the alderman responsible for sustainability in the City of Utrecht.

My team worked on the business case of Cofely GDF Suez, which aimed to think of a way in which energy use could be measured, monitored, and reduced on a personal level in the working environment. Our solution, the EnergyCoach, was chosen as the best by Cofely representatives - we did not manage to win the Challenge, unfortunately. Cofely will, however, investigate whether it is possible to actually implement our proposed solution.

profile_positions.company: Nijmegen School of Management / Faculteit der Managementwetenschappen
profile_positions.description:
As part of the EXPLORE project, I conduct research on the energy transition in the Netherlands. In particular, I aim to understand how and why the Dutch energy transition is organized regionally, and what this means for participation. 

I also work as a lecturer at our faculty, teaching about a.o. research methodology to students of our Geography, Planning & Environment programs.
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
The aim of the Royal Dutch Geographical Society (KNAG) is to bring to the fore the distinctive characteristics of geography as subject and as profession. It does so by organizing conferences, workshops, lectures and seminars (e.g. the annual Onderwijsdag); publishing scientific and more popular journals and books (e.g. Geografie.nl & Tijdschrift voor Economische en Sociale Geografie); and providing support to and services for its over 3000 members. The society functions as a meeting place to share ideas, knowledge and information.

As project employee, I was predominantly responsible for running the editorial secretariat of the Tijdschrift voor Economische en Sociale Geografie (TESG - Journal of Economic and Social Geography), for which I worked together with the journal's Editor-in-Chief and Executive Director. TESG is a leading international journal on contemporary issues in human geography that is published by KNAG in collaboration with Wiley. It offers space to specialized discussions on economic, social, cultural and political geographical themes, development studies, as well as interdisciplinary, overview and survey articles.
profile_positions.title: Project Employee (Projectmedewerker)

profile_positions.description:
Live Your Story is an organization that aims to "bring worlds together" by celebrating diversity (of age, religion, sexual orientation, etc.) and embracing the 'other'. It uses theater performances - delivered by young people and based on real stories - as a means to raise awareness of and spark debate on issues such as love and sexual diversity, racism and discrimination. 

I have been involved as an actor and facilitator (of discussions and workshops) in the theater performance Homonologen. This performance explores the topic of “being young and in love”, and is performed in school class rooms, at companies, organizations or events. It aims to create a safe environment for discussing questions about love, sexual diversity, and (in)tolerance.
profile_positions.title: Actor and Facilitator

profile_positions.description: As part of my teacher training program at Utrecht University, I worked as a Humanities teaching intern at Trondheim International School, an international school offering the International Baccalaureate's Primary Years Programme (PYP) and Middle Years Programme (MYP). I taught students in the 7th (12-13 year-olds) and 10th (15-16 year-olds) grade of MYP.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Intern - Humanities

profile_positions.description: As part of my teacher training program at Utrecht University, I worked as a teaching intern at the Steinerskolen in Trondheim. I taught History (Historie) and Civics (Samfunnsfag) to the 10th grade in ungdomsskole (15-16 year-olds), as well as Civics to the third grade in videregående skole (18-19 year-olds).
profile_positions.title: Teaching Intern - History and Civics

profile_positions.description: As part of my teacher training program at Utrecht University, I worked as a Geography teaching intern at the Amsterdam International Community School, an international school offering the International Baccalaureate's Middle Years Programme (MYP) and Diploma Programme (DP). At AICS, I taught students in MYP2 (12-13 year-olds), MYP3 (13-14 year-olds) and DP1 (17-18 year-olds).
profile_positions.title: Teaching Intern - Geography

profile_positions.description:
Stadsschouwburg Utrecht offers a wide variety of theater performances throughout the year, as well as the opportunity to have a drink or dine (Mevrouw Dudok & Restaurant Zindering).

As general employee, my responsibility was to welcome, serve, and monitor the safety of visitors of Stadsschouwburg Utrecht and Restaurant Zindering.
profile_positions.title: General Employee (Algemeen Medewerker)

profile_positions.description:
I worked as an intern at Waag, an institute that has for over twenty years operated at the intersection of science, technology and the arts, focusing on technology as an instrument of social change, and guided by the values of fairness, openness and inclusivity. At Waag, I contributed to the organization's work and research on digital social innovation, as part of the European Union-supported DSI4EU/DSISCALE project. This project seeks to encourage and scale up the use of technology for inducing socially and environmentally sustainable change.

My responsibilities included: conducting research for and co-writing a deliverable for the DSI4EU project; writing blogposts; helping conceptualize project and event programs.
profile_positions.title: Research and Project Intern

profile_positions.description:
I worked as an intern for Pop-Up City, an Amsterdam-based agency for urban transformation. Pop-Up City is specialised in strategies to make cities adapt to a 'state of permanent transformation'. It explores the trends and ideas that shape the city of tomorrow and helps governments, non-profits and enterprises act on them.

In this position, I used my Dutch and English speaking and writing skills to create digital publications and develop content for clients.

My responsibilities included: writing articles for online magazine Pop-Up City and Golfstromen's clients; working on a variety of commissioned and self-initiated projects and events, ranging from urban development and communication and branding to public events (like PechaKucha Amsterdam).
profile_positions.title: Project and Editorial Intern

company.name: EURENSSA - EURopean ENvironmental Science Student Association

profile_positions.company: EURENSSA - EURopean ENvironmental Science Student Association
profile_positions.description:
I was voluntarily involved in the organization of EURENSSA's yearly conference: EURENSSA 2017 – Creating the Sustainable City. EURENSSA aims to build a strong network of environmental science, ecology and sustainable development students. Every year, EURENSSA aims to facilitate the exchange of ideas, knowledge, and skills through organizing a 7-10 days long open-air conference which brings together about 35 students studying all over Europe, facilitating and offering them participant presentations, guest lectures, workshops and excursions. 

In the 2017 conference, we invited students from a range of different backgrounds to address the challenges associated with increasing urbanization and a changing climate. We aimed not only to facilitate exchange of knowledge, but also to inspire participants to practically engage with the challenges of their home cities by providing encounters with some of the many successful, Amsterdam-based social and environmental initiatives.

My responsibilities included: compiling and coordinating conference content in terms of guest lectures and workshops; reaching out to and maintaining contact with (potential) conference speakers; logistics and planning of conference.
profile_positions.title: Guest Lecture and Workshop Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description:
Studenten Toneelvereniging Amsterdam (STA!) is a theatre association for students in the Amsterdam region. 

As a member of STA!'s Photography Committee, I took pictures of various theatre performances and other social activities organized throughout the year.

For more information on STA!, see: http://www.sta-toneel.nl/.

As a member of the NJR Working Group on Sustainable Development (NJR Werkgroep Jong & Duurzaam), I gave interactive guest lectures to high school students on a range of sustainability issues.

For more information about NJR and the working group, visit http://www.njr.nl/ and http://www.jongenduurzaam.nl/.
I volunteered to count votes cast in the Southeast borough (Stadsdeel Zuidoost) in the municipality of Amsterdam during the municipal elections of 19 March 2014.
